snippet: While there used to be a month or more of indoor tournaments leading into the year-end finals, the tours’ detours into Asia after the U.S. Open have created a more abbreviated season.
abstract: World Tennis Assn chief executive Stacey Allaster says growth of outdoor fall tennis in Asia has reduced number of indoor tournaments once available to players at that time of year; adds that more spacious outdoor events have also contributed to decline of indoor tournaments.
lead_paragraph: While there used to be a month or more of indoor tournaments leading into the year-end finals, the tours’ detours into Asia after the U.S. Open have created a more abbreviated season.

headline.main: As Tours Evolve, Indoor Tennis Tournaments Are Increasingly Being Left Out
headline.print_headline: As Tours Evolve, Indoor Tournaments Are Increasingly Being Left Out

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
